summary: Lancashire is a county in northwest England, bordering Cumbria, Yorkshire, Greater Manchester, and the Irish Sea. Its biggest city is Preston. With an area of 1,189 square miles and a population of about 1.5 million, it includes towns like Blackpool and Blackburn. Historically, Lancashire included parts of modern-day Greater Manchester and Merseyside. It has a mix of flat coastal plains and hilly landscapes, with major rivers like the Lune, Wyre, and Ribble. Founded in the 12th century, it was once a poor area but became very industrial during the Industrial Revolution, known for its coal mines and textile manufacturing.
title: Lancashire
